entries.label: Terraform
entries.description: An open-source infrastructure as code software tool created by HashiCorp.

entries.label: AWS CloudFormation
entries.description: A service that gives developers and businesses an easy way to create a collection of related AWS and third-party resources.

entries.label: Ansible
entries.description: An open-source software provisioning, configuration management, and application-deployment tool.

entries.label: Chef
entries.description: A configuration management tool written in Ruby and Erlang.

entries.label: Google Cloud Platform
entries.description: A suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure that Google uses internally for its end-user products.

entries.label: Amazon Web Services
entries.description: A subsidiary of Amazon providing on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs.

entries.label: Microsoft Azure
entries.description: A cloud computing service created by Microsoft for building, testing, deploying, and managing applications and services.

entries.label: VMware
entries.description: A leading provider of multi-cloud services for all apps, enabling digital innovation with enterprise control.

entries.label: Docker
entries.description: A set of platform-as-a-service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

entries.label: Kubernetes
entries.description: An open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.
